title: What species was Spock? - Quora

response.answer_text: Spock was a hybrid between an H. sapiens mother and a Vulcan father. Star Trek was never big on identifying the species of sapients not from Earth. Thus, we get “Vulcans” and “Klingons” but not a species name. Among hybrids on earth, we do not give a species name to a hybrid. Nor do we assign them to one species or the other. Instead, we make an “x” to denote a cross. Mule - Wikipedia “Species: E. asinus♂ × E. caballus” If you wanted to follow the convention, Spock would be “(Vulcan specie) x H. sapiens”. The show, like many science fiction shows, played fast and loose with the science in order to advance the fiction of the story. Biologically, the idea that individuals from 2 sapient species that had separate evolutionary histories could mate and produce a viable offspring is absurd. Niven did this better in his Ringworld series, where the various hominid species could have sex, but not offspring. He even had a word — rishathra — for sex outside your species. However, Star Trek wanted to explore ideas of what is human, and specifically the role of emotions in being human. The writers could mix and match human and Vulcan physiological traits to match the story, i.e. when Spock was not killed by a creature that sucked out hemoglobin in human blood to get the iron because he had a copper based oxygen transport molecule.

Spock wasn’t ONE species; he is a hybrid of TWO species. He’s a Vulcan-Human Hybrid; this means he’s half Vulcan and half Human. Just like T’Lin Archer is in my first Star Trek novel set in 2163 after the Star Trek: Enterprise Series Finale “These Are The Voyages…”. Spock’s father Sarek was a Full Vulcan male and his mother Amanda was a Full Human female.  For T’Lin Archer her mother his a Full Vulcan; T’Pol and her father is a Full Human; Jonathan Archer. Vulcan-Human Hybrids are not the only hybrids in Star Trek either. Hybrid

Question as asked: What species was Spock? We don’t know anything about Vulcan taxonomical nomenclature. There’s no canonical information about it. So we don’t know the formal name for the Vulcan humanoid sapient species — assuming there is one, and that the word or words that translates as ‘a Vulcan’ through the translator isn’t the same as that formal name. But whatever it is, Spock’s species would be a hybrid of half that, and half human.

With Spock it isn't a simple an simple answer. He is a hybrid with a Vulcan father and human mother. Physically he was genetically engineered to be full Vulcan with pointed ears, green blood and heart where his liver should be.. He did have human elements in his type T negative blood. So he is a Vulcan by lifestyle and genetics. They live up to 250 years and are ten times stronger than humans. He was raised and trained to be a Vulcan.

Spock was a hybrid. His father was Sarek, a Vulcan astrophysicist and ambassador. His mother was Amanda Grayson, a human teacher. This has led to a conflict with his mother trying to teach him to value emotion while his father taught him Vulcan discipline and logic. Spock's physical characteristics are interestingly far more Vulcan than human-green blood, limited telepathy and superhuman strength and resilience.
